item.title: Louvain Modularity
item.description: Louvain Modularity # The Louvain algorithm partitions the network by finding the partition that optimizes modularity, defined as (Barab√°si eq. 9.12): \(M = \sum_{c=1}^{n_c}\left[\frac{L_c}{L}-\left(\frac{k_c}{2L}\right)^2\right]\) , where \(n_c\) is the number of communities/partitions, \(L\) is the total number of links in the network, \(L_c\) is the total number of links within community \(C_c\) , and \(k_c\) is the total degree of the nodes in this community (including links to nodes outside community \(C_c\) ).

item.title: TF and TF-IDF
item.description: TF and TF-IDF # According to Wiki, there is a variaty of ways to calculate TF-IDF. We calculate TF-IDF in what appears to be the most conventional way, where the raw count, \( f_{t,d}\) , of term \(t\) in document \( d\) is standardized/adjusted by the document length, \( \sum_{t'\in{d}}f_{t',d}\) , e.i. adjusted by the raw count of all the terms, \( t'\) , in \(d\) .
